intro: Gordonia luzonica, commonly known as the Luzon gordonia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Gordonia luzonica is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
